Q: Table layout adjusting insides of components A:

Having ruled out the use of *JTable* (it extremely complicated), the simplest way I can think of is to create several *JPanel*s, one containing the labels -> “Primary,” “Secondary,” “Sidearm,” another with the *JComboBox* -> “25g,” “45g,” “6g,” etc... then use your preferred layout manager.

Q: Apache Directory Studio on Apple M1 Silicon A:

I built it from source. Here are the steps I did:

$ brew install --cask temurin@17
$ brew install maven
$ git clone https://github.com/apache/directory-studio.git
$ cd directory-studio
$ JAVA_HOME=/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/temurin-17.jdk/Contents/Home ./build.sh

Then you can find the built ApacheDirectoryStudio.app application in the product/target/products/org.apache.directory.studio.product/macosx/cocoa/aarch64 subdirectory.

Q: Recursive common table expression initial select search with primary key A:

Few important areas to look into -

Pushing the filer to anchor term - add a WHERE that limits the anchor term to the one starting node you care about.


WITH RECURSIVE chain(id_first, id, content) AS (
  -- Anchor:Start from id = 1 only
  SELECT id, id, content
  FROM node
  WHERE id = 1

  UNION ALL

  -- Recursive: follow the links
  SELECT chain.id_first, node.id, node.content
  FROM chain
  JOIN link ON link.id_src = chain.id
  JOIN node ON node.id = link.id_dst
)
SELECT * FROM chain;

Using literal seed if id_first is a parameter


WITH RECURSIVE chain(id_first, id, content) AS (
  -- Seed chain with the starting id (parameterized)
  SELECT ? AS id_first, id, content
  FROM node
  WHERE id = ?

  UNION ALL

  SELECT chain.id_first, node.id, node.content
  FROM chain
  JOIN link ON link.id_src = chain.id
  JOIN node ON node.id = link.id_dst
)
SELECT * FROM chain;

And the last one is Seed via your values , in case you dont want to content in the anchor:


WITH RECURSIVE chain(id_first, id) AS (
  VALUES(1, 1)  -- seed id_first=1, id=1

  UNION ALL

  SELECT chain.id_first, link.id_dst
  FROM chain
  JOIN link ON link.id_src = chain.id
)
SELECT chain.id_first, node.id, node.content
FROM chain
JOIN node ON node.id = chain.id;

Note : Recursive CTEs are planned mainly in two parts:

Anchor term: initial rows that seed the recursion.

Recursive term: repeatedly applied to rows from the working table.

SQLite generally treats the outer SELECT filter (WHERE id_first = 1) as independent from the anchor generation, so it does not automatically transform your anchor to be selective. This is a design/optimization choice and consistent with how many engines plan recursive queries. Hope it gives you some amount of clarity on your approach.

Q: How to Increase Font of Menu bar in Eclipse A:

If your problem is that, in an external monitor, the font size is too small, while on the main monitor, it is OK, then the answer is in the Windows settings for Display.

In Windows 11, anyway: open the Windows Settings, then

 System -> Display.

Click on the problem display. Under "Scale & Layout", there is a
Scale setting, that sets the font scaling for windows in that display.

(Eclipse has its own settings for fonts in the content parts of its own windows.)
